alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 9:29PM CDT until April 26 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Pembina, Kittson, Marshall and Walsh Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Polk, Walsh, Marshall and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY, APRIL 26... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North near Hickson. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Wednesday, April 26. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, North Dakota Hwy 18 bridge approach closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 26.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Friday morning to a crest of 31.5 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
